page.title: 11RECREATION
page.content: {Angling:}Both banks of the{Stour}are rented to Angling Clubs. Some stretches are{day ticket water,}much patronised by visiting clubs, some coming from the Midlands. The river is tidal and fairly fast on both ebb and flow. It tends to be rather murky on the flow with clear water coming down afterwards. Because of the speed of the current, ledgering and float ledgering are most popular. Trotting a float down stream requires a long rod and a lot of energy, but can produce splendid Roach.{Favoured baits}are maggot and bread flake. Ledgering with a large ball of paste can pick up{big {Bream,}six pounders being not unusual. Lobworm bait will lure eels and the occasional Perch. Tench and Pike ae to be caught by fishing the slack where a dyke opens into the main river.
